result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie B Anderson

records.addlTxt: Court will be down on 12-16-2022.  Court rescheduled final pretrial.  Parties notified of new date.  Final pretrial scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Willie B Anderson in court.  
Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Willie B Anderson. 
Attorney Michael Staskunas for Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file any substantive motions by 11-15-2022 and any objections must be submitted in written form by 12-13-2022.
Case remains calendared in Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022
Received and Filed:  Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

Defendant Willie B Anderson in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Willie B Anderson. Attorney William Ackell appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-16-2022

Defendant Willie B Anderson in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Willie B Anderson in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie B Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for an arraignment. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie B Anderson in court, appear by video with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear by video.  Defendant Willie B Anderson in custody. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice to case 19CF4600. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Langer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Defense requests an arraignment date. Date provided byBr 40 clerk.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie B Anderson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Willie B Anderson in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie B Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter this case has been re-assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 amd 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
